concept.title: Setting up the GraphViz Tool
concept.shortdesc: The open-source GraphViz tool is required in order to render graphs using the DITA for Publishers GraphViz plugin.

conbody.p: The GraphViz tool (http://graphviz.net) is an open-source command-line tool that generates node-and-arc graphs from simple text data files. The DITA for Publishers graph-generation plugin calls the graphviz command to create rendered graphs.
To set up the GraphViz tool, download the package for your platform (GraphViz is available for most, if not all platforms) and install it normally.

You can either add the location of the GraphViz "dot" command to your PATH environment variable or you can set the Ant property graphviz.dot.executable to the full path to the "dot" command (e.g., "/usr/local/bin/dot" or "c:/Program Files/GraphViz/bin/dot").
